page.title: 05 THE THORLEY DEVELOPMENT
page.content: Bishop's Stortford's new suburb at Thorley was conceived in the 1960s when Government said money would be given for development. The project was designed to provide 3000 houses & increase population by 9000. In 1973 the council bought 104 acres of farmland to the south west of town.However the project was halted until 1977.Elliot Ltd.constructed the first 123 houses.The council then negotiated with several building firms.Land remained in the council's ownership until each house sold.Recently land has been sold outright while planning control has been retained.The boom at Thorley began in 1981 & the area has rapidly developed on the fringes of an old market town.
